poem:
**In the Shadow of COP30**

In the swirl of headlines,  
a whisper of green—  
where promises fall,  
new roots take hold—  
delicate, yet fierce,  
amongst the pages turned.  
Hope unfurls,  
waiting for spring,  
where word becomes deed,  
and breath finds its rhythm  
in the balance of earth.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Beyond the negative headlines, some truly good things came out of Cop30 Some commentators have called Cop30 a failure. An attempt to insert plans for a route to the phaseout of fossil fuels into the legal text was stymied, consideration of how to improve countries’ emissions-cutting plans was put off till next year, and although developing countries got the tripling of finance for adaptation that they were seeking, it will not be delivered in full". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
